PositionHistory.Title: Professor of Marketing Strategy and Sales
PositionHistory.Description: Facilitate active learning and independent thinking among junior and senior business majors with mission to shape future leaders who are prepared to successfully and ethically run global businesses. • Core subject is marketing strategy: conduct hands-on teaching to develop skills in competitor analysis; situational analysis; segmentation, targeting, and positioning; 4Ps build-out; financial modeling; metric monitoring; new product development; product lifecycle management; and S curve modeling. • Extended subjects include: Advertising, Marketing Management, and Personal Selling. • Teach 100+ junior and senior business majors each semester.

EmployerOrg.EmployerOrgName: E.I. DU PONT DE NEMOURS AND COMPANY

OrgName.OrganizationName: E.I. DU PONT DE NEMOURS AND COMPANY

PositionHistory.Title: Global Manager
PositionHistory.Description: Led full portfolio of $3.4 billion Health & Nutrition business unit's global food and pharmaceutical safety business with 100% P&L accountability. Established global strategies. Directed incremental and disruptive innovation identification and product commercialization efforts, and spearheaded sales campaigns. • Set new precedent for product commercialization by compressing technology adoption and revenue realization process to six months, vs. historical two-to-three year timeframe. Reforecast sales increase by $5M in 2014. • Led monthly global stage-gate review of 30 new product development efforts across the Food BioProtection Division. • Worked with 11 Regional Product Managers around the world to drive global strategies into tactical regional plans for successful technology adoption and sales execution. • Created a growth program to bring transparency and accountability to delivering against adoption and sales targets for key new products. • Overhauled portfolio pricing and product positioning to maintain variable margin levels and retain 96% of customers in fragmenting and commoditizing market.

PositionHistory.Title: Global Manager

OrgName.OrganizationName: Health & Nutrition Division, Food Diagnostics Protection Business

PositionHistory.Description: Managed 65% of product portfolio P&L accountability. Led daily business operations, while creating global marketing objectives, strategies and tactics to grow business. • Identified and drove 10 new product development efforts across the portfolios. Validated product strategy, specifications, and product adoption case utilizing voice of customer, competitive benchmarking, and market research, and by projecting global government regulation changes. Pitched new product development plans to a cross functional team for funding approval and resource allocation. Represented customer and market insights throughout the stage gate process. Initiated and won support for 2 new product develop efforts with 2013 commercialization dates and expected revenue of $5M in year one. • Overhauled strategy for important, but lagging product by repositioning it and redirecting U.S.-focused resources to global markets, resulting in sales of $1.1M versus $97K in 2011. • Negotiated non-exclusive licensing agreement with South Korean company to deliver disruptive, next-generation technology. Developed product specifications and business case, as well as strategic positioning, technology adoption rates, and financing terms. 2015 expected revenue is $6M. • Led business turnaround by focusing on quality control, inventory management, global marketing, and sales force retraining. Exceeded target revenue by 5%.

PositionHistory.Title: Asia Pacific Marketing Manager
PositionHistory.Description: Launched dramatically new regional strategic marketing process focused on addressing critical short-term growth issues with special emphasis on China, India, and Southeast Asia. • Primary market was agriculture- crop and food protection. Initiatives addressed repositioning current products to maximize profitability, new product development, and country penetration strategies. • Led cross-functional teams to identify opportunities and trouble shoot technology and commercialization challenges. Delivered incremental revenue of $3M USD within 15 months. • Exceeded strategic business targets by completing work in rapid, 18-month timeframe. • Created and implemented customized change management approach that became best practice and has been adopted globally.

PositionHistory.Title: Global Marketing Strategy Consultant
PositionHistory.Description: Provided subject matter expertise as member of internal consulting team to significantly increase profitability across multiple and highly-varied company businesses. • Directed pricing overhaul for Pioneer Seed Corn Business that identified $30 million revenue gain for 2009 season by conducting competitor pricing analysis, and by capturing pricing discrepancies across product portfolio. • Conducted market and customer segmentation for Chemical Solutions Enterprises Specialty Polymer Solutions business that led to $5 million in saving through significant capital cost improvements and positive price/volume growth trade-offs. • Implemented simplified segmentation methodology to support fast customer-focused decision-making for FluroPolymer Solutions business - helping it weather dramatic downturn because of weak global economic conditions, leading to $60M fixed cost savings in one year.

PositionHistory.Title: Independent Business Owner and Sales Leader
PositionHistory.Description:
Bentleyville, PA Created and implemented start-up business plan for leading national direct sales franchise. Led, managed and trained 25-person sales team, building strong retention in this high-turnover industry. • Planned and launched segmentation and targeting strategies to grow business from zero to more than 500 customers within two years. • Produced robust repeat sales with 80% of customer base consisting of loyal purchasers; 30% of customers maintained for three or more years with high average sales per customer. • Qualified for "Career Car Program" - a revenue-based and team-building performance bonus achieved by approximately 3% of sales representatives globally.
AFFILIATION • Member, Board of Directors, Penn State University, Smeal College of Business MBA Program • Member, Board of Directors, Shippensburg University Alumni Association • Founding Member, Lean In, Chester County • Past Member, Board of Directors, DuPont Marketing Leadership Development Program • Past Leader, DuPont Women's Network

Degree.Comments:
• DuPont Federal Government Division - North America Marketing Strategy Consultant, 2007 ◦ Identified opportunities and strategies to drive adoption of DuPont products by the Department of Defense and Department of Energy
SHIPPPENSBURG UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA, Shippensburg, PA Bachelor of Science in Business Administration
• President, Beta Gamma Sigma (national business honor society)
• Leader, International Business Association
• President, Phi Beta Lambda (Future Business Leaders of America)
• Magna Cum Laude Graduate
• Honors College Graduate

Qualifications.QualificationSummary:
AREAS OF EXPERTISE
Senior Business Leader and Marketing Professional with more than 15 years of experience in multiple business to business and business to consumer settings. Proven technical, financial management, change management, and problem solving skills. Outstanding track-record in building high-performing teams to achieve results. Extensive experience working in global markets; recently lived in China for 2 years with Asia-wide responsibility. Full P&L accountability in the food protection and consumer goods industries. Specific expertise includes:
• Create financial models and determine product adoption rates • Determine market opportunities for incremental and disruptive innovation initiatives • Concentrated knowledge of China, India, and Southeast Asia markets • Lead senior management and multi-functional teams to drive new product development • Extensive involvement in agriculture markets- crop and food protection • Implement initiatives in dynamic and diverse environments

Proven technical, financial management, change management, and problem solving skills. Outstanding track-record in building high-performing teams to achieve results. Extensive experience working in global markets; recently lived in China for 2 years with Asia-wide responsibility. Full P&L accountability in the food protection and consumer goods industries. Specific expertise includes
President, Beta Gamma Sigma (national business honor society)

Recognized with DuPont Pioneer Award for developing new recruiting strategy for marketing talent in China that saved $1M in first year and increased retention rate for marketing talent from 5% to 85% over five years, 2011

Recognized with DuPont Pioneer Award for developing and implementing three-component curriculum program (general management, marketing and leadership) for top marketing talent in company. Elected to internal Board of Directors for marketing talent, 2009
Celebrating Women of Character, Courage, and Commitment faculty honoree. Office of Leadership Empowerment and Development, West Chester University, 2014

Recruited by Investor Relations team to build executive presentations for company's five-year outlook and to finalize key messages and materials for Wall Street. Worked directly with senior leaders, including Chief Financial Officer and Chief Executive Officer, 2009
FedEx Freight International Graduate Logistics Case Competition, 3rd Place, 2008
Mary Kay Cosmetics: set unit recruiting record in 2002 with 16 new team-members; multiple time Silver and Bronze Medal winner for recruiting efforts

NonXMLResume.TextResume:
Jodie Vanderman Driver, MBA
234 Heather Ridge Circle Cell: (724) 255-2295 West Chester, PA 19382 JodieVDriver@gmail.com ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
AREAS OF EXPERTISE
Senior Business Leader and Marketing Professional with more than 15 years of experience in multiple business to business and business to consumer settings. Proven technical, financial management, change management, and problem solving skills. Outstanding track-record in building high-performing teams to achieve results. Extensive experience working in global markets; recently lived in China for 2 years with Asia-wide responsibility. Full P&L accountability in the food protection and consumer goods industries. Specific expertise includes:
• Create financial models and determine product adoption rates • Determine market opportunities for incremental and disruptive innovation initiatives • Concentrated knowledge of China, India, and Southeast Asia markets • Lead senior management and multi-functional teams to drive new product development • Extensive involvement in agriculture markets- crop and food protection • Implement initiatives in dynamic and diverse environments
EDUCATION
PENNSYLVANIA STATE UNIVERSITY, University Park, PA Master of Business Administration, Product and Market Development and Strategic Leadership • President, Student Government • Vice President, Marketing Association • Graduate Assistantships: ◦ Office of the Dean - Academic Integrity, 2007 * Created and implemented academic integrity guidelines within the College of Business ◦ Office of the Dean of Executive Education, 2007-2008 * Developed adult education programming for corporate customers • DuPont Federal Government Division - North America Marketing Strategy Consultant, 2007 ◦ Identified opportunities and strategies to drive adoption of DuPont products by the Department of Defense and Department of Energy
SHIPPPENSBURG UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA, Shippensburg, PA Bachelor of Science in Business Administration • President, Beta Gamma Sigma (national business honor society) • Leader, International Business Association • President, Phi Beta Lambda (Future Business Leaders of America) • Magna Cum Laude Graduate • Honors College Graduate • John L. and Cora I. Groves Scholar • Internships: JLG Industries - International Sales, 1998; East Meets West Emporium - Retail Marketing, 1999; Orrstown Bank - Promotions and Public Relations; 1999
Jodie Vanderman Driver ~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
PUBLICATIONS
China Marketing Managers Development Program (internal publication for DuPont, Vanderman J.). Developed, documented, and taught 16-week, project-based course for top marketing talent in China focused on effectively commercializing new technology and gaining rapid adoption, 2010.
Build, Fix or Terminate: The Distributor's Guide to More Profitable Supplier Relations. ISBN 1-934014-16-8, 2009. Research and content contributor to book by James A. Narus and Bob Donath. Publication focuses on distributors' relationships with manufacturers and suppliers, 2009.
Rapid Customer Segmentation and Product Offering Design (internal publication for DuPont, Paul D. and Vanderman J.). Developed, documented and taught simplified segmentation methodology to enhance swift, customer-focused decision making in business critical situations and to quickly tailor product offerings to meet unique needs, 2009.
Global General Management, Leadership, and Marketing Training Program (internal publication for DuPont, Vanderman J.). Developed and executed global, three-component curriculum and training program for top marketing talent to complete during their first year in company, 2009.
Determining Prices in Volatile Markets Methodology (internal publication for DuPont, Sato M., Shah M., and Vanderman J.). Developed and documented methodology to identify and track key parameters to support pricing analysis and decision making in unstable markets, 2008.
PRESENTATIONS & EXECUTIVE EDUCATION SEMINARS
Success in the Global Economy. Shippensburg University of Pennsylvania. Shippensburg, PA. 1,500 participations, 2015.
Extend, Extract and Profit: Managing the Product Lifecycle. The Product Management and Innovation Event. Philadelphia, PA. 75 participants, 2014.
How to Use Marketing Strategy Fundamentals to Penetrate Markets. MBA Marketing Association. State College, PA. 12 participants, 2014.
Strategy Development and Execution in Global Settings. Business Strategy and Policy Course. West Chester, PA. 35 participants, 2014.
Working Globally in Business Today. International Management Course. Shippensburg, PA. 8 participants, 2013.
The Global Collaboratory: How to Work Cross-Culturally to Enhance Business Results. Marketing Leadership Development Program Global Conference. Wilmington, DE. 75 participants, 2012.
For Professionals- Applying the Strategic Marketing Process to New Product Development Efforts: One-Day Workshop. DuPont Asia Pacific Refinishes Business. Shanghai, China. 15 participants, 2011.
China Marketing Managers: Commercialize Technology and Win Customers: 16 Week Couse. DuPont China. Shanghai, China. 12 participants, 2010-2011. Jodie Vanderman Driver ~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
PRESENTATIONS & EXECUTIVE EDUCATION SEMINARS, ~~~~~~
Applying the Strategic Marketing Process to Identify Revenue Opportunities: One-Day Workshop. DuPont Crop Protection Business. Singapore. 55 participants, 2010.
The Strategic Marketing Process for Technology & Business Consultants: Two-Day Workshop. DuPont Asia Pacific. Shanghai, China. 35 participants, 2010.
Using Strategic Marketing to Identify New Market Opportunities: One-Day Workshop. DuPont South East Asia. Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. 10 participants, 2010.
The Strategic Marketing Process for Marketing Leaders. DuPont India. Mumbai, India. 10 participants, 2010.
Business Leaders, Use Marketing Strategy to Drive Technology Adoption and Sales: One-Day Workshop. DuPont China. Shanghai, China. 42 participants, 2010.
Rapid Customer Segmentation and Product Offering Redesign: when, why, and how to do it. DuPont North America. Wilmington, DE. 30 participants, 2009.
Determine Prices in Volatile Markets - Online Training and Case Study. DuPont China. Wilmington, DE. 12 participants, 2008.
Jump-Start Your Business: Lead Generation Techniques. Mary Kay Cosmetics January Kick-Off Workshop. Pittsburgh, PA. 200 participants, 2002.
HONORS AND AWARDS
• Achieved 96% student approval rating, 2014. • Celebrating Women of Character, Courage, and Commitment faculty honoree. Office of Leadership Empowerment and Development, West Chester University, 2014. • Recognized with DuPont Pioneer Award for developing new recruiting strategy for marketing talent in China that saved $1M in first year and increased retention rate for marketing talent from 5% to 85% over five years, 2011. • Recruited by Investor Relations team to build executive presentations for company's five-year outlook and to finalize key messages and materials for Wall Street. Worked directly with senior leaders, including Chief Financial Officer and Chief Executive Officer, 2009. • Recognized with DuPont Pioneer Award for developing and implementing three-component curriculum program (general management, marketing and leadership) for top marketing talent in company. Elected to internal Board of Directors for marketing talent, 2009. • FedEx Freight International Graduate Logistics Case Competition, 3rd Place, 2008. • Big 10 Case Competition, 3rd Place, 2007. • Mary Kay Cosmetics: set unit recruiting record in 2002 with 16 new team-members; multiple time Silver and Bronze Medal winner for recruiting efforts.

sov:ExperienceSummary.sov:Description: Jodie Vanderman Driver's experience appears to be concentrated in Marketing (General), with a lesser concentration in Sales (General). Jodie Vanderman Driver has 16 years of work experience, with 10 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
sov:ExperienceSummary.sov:ManagementStory: Starting on 1/1/2013, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 12 months: Title: Global Manager for Food Diagnostics Protection Business, Health & Nutrition Division Starting on 1/1/2012, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 12 months: Title: Global Manager for Food Diagnostics Protection Business, Health & Nutrition Division, Food Diagnostics Protection Business Starting on 1/1/2010, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 2 years: Title: Asia Pacific Marketing Manager Starting on 1/1/2001, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 6 years and 1 months: Title: Independent Business Owner and Sales Leader for MARY KAY COSMETICS
